snippet: An annual ranking of countries according to how corrupt they're perceived to be gives Denmark, Finland and New Zealand the highest marks. At the bottom: Somalia, North Korea and Afghanistan. The United States barely made the top 20, with China...
abstract: An annual ranking of countries according to how corrupt they're perceived to be gives Denmark, Finland and New Zealand the highest marks. At the bottom: Somalia, North Korea and Afghanistan. The United States barely made the top 20, with China roughly in the middle.
